Column Comment.0: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: DISCOVERY DATE: The date that the field was discovered. This may be differentthan effective date.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: FIELD NAME ABBREVIATION: Common abbreviated field name.
Column Comment.8: FIELD AREA OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number added to allow a field to beassociated with areas over time as they change in shape over time.
Column Comment.9: FIELD NAME: Legal or common given name of the field.
Column Comment.10: FIELD TYPE: Identifies the type of field. For example regulatory or locally assigned.
Column Comment.11: GROUP FIELD IDENTIFIER: Used in cases where a field crosses jurisdictionalboundaries, and different codes are assigned to each portion. The group code relatesto the entire field and is independent of the jurisdictional segmentation.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
